alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 6:12PM MST until August 10 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST/8 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Along the US 160 near Tuba City. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MST /800 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 609 PM MST /709 PM MDT/, The Arizona Department of Transportation reported flooding on the US 160 near Tuba City due to thunderstorms. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain fell. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Begashibito Wash, Moenkopi Wash and Fivemile Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuba City, Moenave, Moenkopi, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. - This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 315 and 333. State Route 264 between mile markers 322 and 327. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
